required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the FluidVision Accommodating Intraocular Lens (AIOL) With an Improved Injector System
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Evaluation of the FluidVision Accommodating Intraocular Lens With an Improved Injector System

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the clinical outcomes of an investigational IOL in patients undergoing cataract extraction and intraocular lens implantation using an improved injector system.

primary_outcome.description: Accommodative amplitude is a measure of the ability of the eye to focus from a target that is at distance into a target that is near.
Visual acuity of the eye will be tested with the correction in place.
Adverse events will be collected from time of enrollment to study exit.

arm_group.description: FluidVision AIOL implanted in the capsular bag of the eye during cataract surgery

intervention.description: Investigational implantable medical device intended for long-term use over the lifetime of the cataract subject. An improved injector system was used.
